climbs.name: Tricks in Motion
climbs.fa: Merlin Fortner, John Hartman, Mike Thompson: 1990

content.description:
Tricks in Motion has good climbing, but is contrived and really doesn't follow a line.

Climb up high to the first bolt, either continue straight up to the second (mid 5.10) or climb a foot or two right on big holds and then up a bunch of 5.7 climbing on lower angle rock.
content.protection: 7 bolts and lower off. The first bolt was pretty high and a bolt was added for some reason.
content.location: This route is the leftmost route at Mystical Tricks Cliff and gets lots of sun in the morning.

content.description: Climb the hand crack to a bolted face.
content.location: Hand crack start between Tricks in Motion and Little Miss Tickle.

content.description: Enjoyable face climbing on the far left side of the formation.
content.location: Start as Tricks in Motion, then move left and up at the first bolt.

content.description:
This route doesn't seem any harder than it's neighbor "Mystical Stick".

Stem up a Â block to a stance on top, then move right onto an enjoyable face. The crux comes at a slightly overhanging head-wall, then continue up on fun features to the anchors.
content.location: The furthest left route on the wall, start on a platform at the base of a gully.

climbs.name: Little Miss Tickle
climbs.fa: Kelly Cordner, Margy Marshall, Derick Olson

content.description: Good warm up face climbing. Crux is above 3rd bolt.

climbs.name: Done With Spare Change From Mikey's Pocket
climbs.fa: John Hartman, Mike Thompson, Merlin Fortner: March 1995

content.description:
A route with quite a bit of fun climbing on steep rock.  The first 3 bolts are steep technical face climbing followed by easier terrain, then 3 more bolts on the steep juggy face above the roof to the anchor.

Climb the upper face either left of or right of the bolt line, left seemed nicer and right seemed easier.
content.location:
This route crosses a big roof on the left side of Mystical Tricks Cliff, right of Tricks in Motion.

It gets glorious morning sun.

content.description: Nice face on the far right side of the wall.  Good rock with a nice sustained section of edging.

climbs.name: Baby Got Back
climbs.fa: Mike Forkash, Jeff Neer, Urmas Franosch, 6/2005

content.description: Scramble up to a ledge, then climb the steep juggy face.
content.location: Scramble left from the gully in between the two faces. Climb the face, then lower off.
Just left of Brian's Song. Lower off.
